column4: Hi, I wanna acces a folder (var/www) With a normal user instead of root. How do I do this?
I changed permission, I can't still add files to the folde.r
you could add the group of the folder you want to access to the groups of the user you want to access with
there is no gnome-panel in 11.10. there is gnome-shell or gnome-fallback
I used install gnome-shell, gnome-panel and gnome-tweak tool and change to gnome berfore signing in.
Isn't the gnome-panel installed after that?
there is no gnome-panel. there is gnome3 and gnome3-fallback. what you know of as the "panel" is gone
You can install gnome 2.
no you cannot

if you really want gnome2 and the customizable panel then you either need to check out gnome3 extensions or start looking for a different desktop environment or distribution. if you have some question about how gnome3 works let us know what it is
http://superbfish.com/fish.png
That's gnome 2 on 11.10. The clock is placed weird and there is no show desktop nor a trash can.
there is no gnome2 on 11.10. that looks like fallback, and it looks normal
Okay then I got it wrong I guess. Can i make fallback look like gnome 2?
not really. gnome3 is not intended to be as configuratble
the whole part of gnome fallback is to not have the unity dash or gnome-shell expose
gnome fallback is there to approximate the old gnome-panel layout
I know. I just wondered if I could open it in the terminal.
How do I add System to the panel?
what do you mean "add System"?
To the menu in the top left with "Program" and "Places"
you can't
Argh.
